author: Rob Davies
title: General Motors looks to sell loss-making Vauxhall and Opel | Business
text:
America’s largest automotive company General Motors is in talks over a potential sale of its loss-making European arm Opel to the company behind Peugeot and Citroën.
France’s PSA Group said it was exploring “numerous strategic initiatives” to expand on its existing co-operation with Detroit-based GM, the world’s third-largest carmaker.
PSA said this could include an outright purchase of GM’s European subsidiary Opel, which is better known in the UK as Vauxhall . If a deal goes ahead the enlarged business would overtake Renault to become the second-largest European carmaker, after Volkswagen.
GM has endured years of losses at Opel , its main brand in Europe. It had hoped to break even by now, but last year posted an annual loss of $257m (£206m).
GM and PSA Group formed an alliance in 2012 but in 2013 GM announced it was selling its stake in the venture.
